response.original_title: American Dreams #3: Life, Liberty & the Pursuit of Happiness
response.overview: What happens when the smoke clears?  One of the most remarkable sights was the mass movement of people, on foot, along highways usually reserved for motorized traffic. The Brooklyn & Manhattan bridges, as well as the FDR Drive, which runs along the East River from lower to upper Manhattan, became human rivers with an unhurried but steady flow & no end in sight.
response.title: American Dreams #3: Life, Liberty & the Pursuit of Happiness

release_dates.note: Festival des Cinémas Différents de Paris
